item.title: QuestDB at Big Data LDN 2022
item.guid: QuestDB at Big Data LDN 2022
item.description: Big Data LDN (London) is the UK’s leading free to attend data & analytics conference and exhibition. This year, Javier Ramirez, Developer Advocate at QuestDB, delivered a talk on "Ingesting A Million Time Series Per Second On A Single Instance".

item.title: DevStories #1: Time series for sports prediction markets
item.guid: DevStories #1: Time series for sports prediction markets
item.description: This is a brand-new series for which we interviewed different developers in our community. For the post of this series, we interviewed Kevin Kamto, Co-founder at AthleteX Markets.

item.title: Join Hacktoberfest 2022 and contribute to QuestDB!
item.guid: Join Hacktoberfest 2022 and contribute to QuestDB!
item.description: Hacktoberfest 2022 is starting! We are super excited to meet with other open source contributors and maintainers. To celebrate this, we put together some hints for you to get started.

item.title: Importing 300k rows/sec with io_uring
item.guid: Importing 300k rows/sec with io_uring
item.description: QuestDB 6.5 introduces a new `COPY` commands allowing importing large CSV files. This article reveals the story behind it and highlights the exciting benchmark results using this new SQL command.

item.title: Using BIRCH for anomaly detection with QuestDB

item.description: How to install BIRCH for anomaly detection with QuestDB

item.title: Setting up Basic Authentication for QuestDB open source using Nginx
item.guid: Setting up Basic Authentication for QuestDB open source using Nginx
item.description: How to implement Nginx Basic Authentication for QuestDB open source.

item.title: Time Series Forecasting with TensorFlow and QuestDB
item.guid: Time Series Forecasting with TensorFlow and QuestDB
item.description: Timeseries is a type of data used to train machine learning models. You may have numerical data for predicting housing prices or classification data for categorizing dog and cat breeds. It's also the special type of data used for training machine learning algorithms where time is the crucial component.

item.title: Building a Data Pipeline using QuestDB and Confluent Kafka
item.guid: Building a Data Pipeline using QuestDB and Confluent Kafka
item.description: How to collate data with Kafka and implement a data pipeline that collects real-time ETH market data and stores data to QuestDB through Kafka connections.

item.description: QuestDB 6.4 Release Highlights

item.title: 4Bn rows/sec query benchmark: Clickhouse vs QuestDB vs Timescale
item.guid: 4Bn rows/sec query benchmark: Clickhouse vs QuestDB vs Timescale
item.description: QuestDB 6.3 brings parallel filter execution optimization to our SQL engine allowing us to reduce both cold and hot query execution times quite dramatically.

item.title: How to build a real-time crypto tracker with Redpanda and QuestDB
item.guid: How to build a real-time crypto tracker with Redpanda and QuestDB
item.description: Analyze cryptocurrency price trends in real-time with Redpanda and store for further investigation in QuestDB. Read more

item.description: A short survey of the timeseries databases of today.

item.guid: Enabling Machine Learning in QuestDB with MindsDB

item.guid: Demo of live crypto data streamed with QuestDB and Grafana
item.description: Demo of live crypto data streamed with QuestDB and Grafana

item.title: Crypto Volume Profiles with QuestDB and Julia
item.guid: Crypto Volume Profiles with QuestDB and Julia
item.description: Build Bitcoin volume curves using Julia and QuestDB to better understand the flow of trading throughout the day.

item.title: Visualizing cryptocurrency data with Python, Grafana and QuestDB
item.guid: Visualizing cryptocurrency data with Python, Grafana and QuestDB
item.description: Learn how to using Python to fetch cryptocurrency data from Coinbase, store it in QuestDB, and visualize the data using Grafana.

item.title: How to generate time-series data in QuestDB
item.guid: How to generate time-series data in QuestDB
item.description: Learn how to mock timeseries data using built-in SQL functions in QuestDB to generate dummy data for testing and rapid prototyping according to your schemas.

item.title: Exploring Crypto Prices with QuestDB and Pandas
item.guid: Exploring Crypto Prices with QuestDB and Pandas
item.description: Visualizing historical prices of cryptocurrencies by ingesting data into QuestDB and analyzing trends with pandas, matplotlib, and seaborn. records on the fly.

item.title: Calling on our community members to help us support Ukraine
item.guid: Calling on our community members to help us support Ukraine
item.description: We thank all our stakeholders, users and community members for your support during these challenging times.

item.title: Exploring cryptocurrency prices with QuestDB and Google Data Studio
item.guid: Exploring cryptocurrency prices with QuestDB and Google Data Studio
item.description: Visualizing historical prices of Ethereum, Cardano, and Solana by ingesting data into QuestDB and graphing price trends on Google Data Studio. records on the fly.

item.title: Order Flow Imbalance - A High Frequency Trading Signal
item.guid: Order Flow Imbalance - A High Frequency Trading Signal
item.description: Calculate the order flow imbalance and build a high-frequency trading signal with the results. Read more

item.title: QuestDB 6.2 January release, SQL JIT compiler
item.guid: QuestDB 6.2 January release, SQL JIT compiler
item.description: We've released version 6.2 and here are the highlights including SQL JIT compiler, JDK 17 support, SQL and ILP improvements and autocomplete in the Web Console.

item.title: How we built a SIMD JIT compiler for SQL in QuestDB
item.guid: How we built a SIMD JIT compiler for SQL in QuestDB
item.description: QuestDB 6.2.0 brings a brand new JIT (Just-in-Time) compiler as a part of the SQL engine. This post describes our storage model, how we built a JIT compiler for SQL and our plans for improving it in future.

item.title: Our two-year journey to raise $15m in venture capital
item.guid: Our two-year journey to raise $15m in venture capital
item.description: We've raised over $15 million in venture capital to fund development of the fastest open source time series database. This post describes our two-year journey to raising our $12.5m Series A, what we learned along the way, and the pitch deck we used.

item.title: QuestDB 6.1.3 December release, Prometheus improvements
item.guid: QuestDB 6.1.3 December release, Prometheus improvements
item.description: We've released version 6.1.3 and here's the highlights including Prometheus metrics, Prometheus Alertmanager support, SQL additions and Monaco Editor support.

item.title: Comparing InfluxDB and QuestDB databases
item.guid: Comparing InfluxDB and QuestDB databases
item.description: An overview of InfluxDB versus QuestDB to compare features, functionality, performance, and ease of use.

item.title: A tour of high-frequency finance via the Julia language and QuestDB
item.guid: A tour of high-frequency finance via the Julia language and QuestDB
item.description: Dean Markwick describes high-frequency finance concepts such as trade prices, financial returns, time series autocorrelation, empirical price impact and others via the Julia programming language.

item.title: Why I joined QuestDB as a core database engineer
item.guid: Why I joined QuestDB as a core database engineer
item.description: The story of how Miguel Arregui joined as a software engineer building the fastest open source time series database.

item.title: How we built inter-thread messaging from scratch
item.guid: How we built inter-thread messaging from scratch
item.description: Detailed explanation of QuestDB's thread messaging system. A benchmark also shows the capabilities of this system.

item.title: Real-time stock price dashboard using QuestDB, Python and Plotly
item.guid: Real-time stock price dashboard using QuestDB, Python and Plotly
item.description: How to schedule tasks in Python, store stock market data in QuestDB, and create beautiful real-time dashboards using Plotly and Dash.

item.title: Demo geospatial and timeseries queries on 250k unique devices
item.guid: Demo geospatial and timeseries queries on 250k unique devices
item.description: We now support geospatial data in our time series database by adding geohashes to our type system along with language features to support common operations using this type.

item.title: Join Hacktoberfest 2021 and contribute to QuestDB!
item.guid: Join Hacktoberfest 2021 and contribute to QuestDB!
item.description: Hacktoberfest 2021 is starting! We are super excited to meet with other open source contributors and maintainers. To celebrate this, we put together some hints for you to get started.

item.title: High frequency finance with Julia and QuestDB
item.guid: High frequency finance with Julia and QuestDB
item.description: Learn how to use QuestDB as a time series database for high-frequency trading, calculate the limit order book, price impact, trade sign distribution, and other concepts via the Julia programming language.

item.title: QuestDB 6.0.5 September release, geospatial support
item.guid: QuestDB 6.0.5 September release, geospatial support
item.description: QuestDB 6.0.5 is available now and includes support for geospatial data with the introduction of geohash support for fast and efficient geodata queries and storage.

item.title: Launch a QuestDB droplet in 1-click via the DigitalOcean marketplace
item.guid: Launch a QuestDB droplet in 1-click via the DigitalOcean marketplace
item.description: QuestDB can now be launched on DigitalOcean via 1-Click apps which allows you to get started with a high-performance time series database on the cloud quickly and easily.

item.title: Comparing TimescaleDB and QuestDB timeseries databases
item.guid: Comparing TimescaleDB and QuestDB timeseries databases
item.description: How to use the Time Series Benchmark Suite to compare database read and write performance of QuestDB versus TimescaleDB.

item.title: QuestDB 6.0.4 July release, Prometheus metrics support
item.guid: QuestDB 6.0.4 July release, Prometheus metrics support
item.description: QuestDB 6.0.4 is available now with highlights such as performance improvements, increased parallelization of existing code, calendar alignment for `SAMPLE BY` queries, and a new Prometheus endpoint.

item.title: Using Telegraf and QuestDB to store metrics in a time series database
item.guid: Using Telegraf and QuestDB to store metrics in a time series database
item.description: How to use the Telegraf agent to collect system metrics from DigitalOcean droplets, store the metrics in QuestDB, and perform basic data visualization and SQL queries using a time series database.

item.title: Comparing InfluxDB, TimescaleDB, and QuestDB timeseries databases
item.guid: Comparing InfluxDB, TimescaleDB, and QuestDB timeseries databases
item.description: A high-level overview of timeseries databases to compare features, functionality, maturity, and performance.

item.title: Tracking multiple cryptocurrency exchanges using a time series database
item.guid: Tracking multiple cryptocurrency exchanges using a time series database
item.description: Leveraging QuestDB’s data ingestion via InfluxDB line protocol to build a high-throughput cryptocurrency price tracker capable of handling out-of-order records on the fly.

item.title: How databases handle 10 million devices in high-cardinality benchmarks
item.guid: How databases handle 10 million devices in high-cardinality benchmarks
item.description: Most open source time series databases struggle with high-cardinality time series data. Learn more about high-cardinality and how to benchmark database performance with this type of data.

item.title: How we achieved write speeds of 1.4 million rows per second
item.guid: How we achieved write speeds of 1.4 million rows per second
item.description: Our new ingestion framework can sort time series data before writing to disk. Here's how we built it and how it compares to InfluxDB, ClickHouse, and TimescaleDB.

item.title: QuestDB version 6.0 alpha
item.guid: QuestDB version 6.0 alpha
item.description: An alpha version for QuestDB version 6.0 is available now to test with highlights such as out-of-order support, improved InfluxDB Line Protocol ingestion and multiple fixes and improvements

item.title: Streaming on-chain Ethereum data to QuestDB
item.guid: Streaming on-chain Ethereum data to QuestDB
item.description: Learn how to use Infura, Blockchain ETL, and QuestDB to stream Ethereum data to a time series database for visualization and analysis.

item.title: Automating ETL jobs on time series data with QuestDB on Google Cloud Platform
item.guid: Automating ETL jobs on time series data with QuestDB on Google Cloud Platform
item.description: Learn how to build an ETL job using Cloud Functions to extract data, remove personally-identifiable information, and load the transformed time series data into QuestDB.

item.title: Running QuestDB and Prometheus on GKE Autopilot
item.guid: Running QuestDB and Prometheus on GKE Autopilot
item.description: Learn how Google Kubernetes Engine in Autopilot can run QuestDB and Prometheus with automated backups for a production-ready time series database deployment.

item.title: Real-time stock price alerts using Python, Grafana and QuestDB
item.guid: Real-time stock price alerts using Python, Grafana and QuestDB
item.description: Use Python to query stock prices via REST API, stream the results to QuestDB, and configure Slack alerts based on changes in time series data using Grafana.

item.title: Realtime crypto tracker with Kafka and QuestDB
item.guid: Realtime crypto tracker with Kafka and QuestDB
item.description: Use Python to send real-time cryptocurrency metrics to Kafka topics, ingest to QuestDB, and calculate moving averages with Pandas.

item.title: QuestDB 5.0.6 Release Highlights, January 2021
item.guid: QuestDB 5.0.6 Release Highlights, January 2021
item.description: We've released version 5.0.6 and here's the highlights including PostgreSQL wire improvements, SQL additions and new functions for troubleshooting

item.title: Stream heart rate data into QuestDB via Google IoT Core
item.guid: Stream heart rate data into QuestDB via Google IoT Core
item.description: An end-to-end demo of a simple IoT system to stream and visualize heart rate data in Grafana via Google Cloud Platform

item.title: A low-code bitcoin ticker built with QuestDB and n8n.io
item.guid: A low-code bitcoin ticker built with QuestDB and n8n.io
item.description: This tutorial shows how to build a bitcoin ticker for ingesting real-time data into QuestDB using n8n.io

item.title: Monitoring the uptime of an application with Python, Nuxt.js and QuestDB
item.guid: Monitoring the uptime of an application with Python, Nuxt.js and QuestDB
item.description: This detailed tutorial shows how to use QuestDB in a robust application status page and includes a repository with the example code ready to deploy.

item.title: SQL Extensions for Time-Series Data in QuestDB
item.guid: SQL Extensions for Time-Series Data in QuestDB
item.description: A short hands-on tutorial on how to use SQL extensions built for time-series data in QuestDB

item.title: Building a garbage-free network stack for Kafka streams
item.guid: Building a garbage-free network stack for Kafka streams
item.description: Our database's network stack handles multiple TCP connections on a single thread without garbage collection for reliably ingesting time series data.

item.title: What is time-series data, and why are we building a time-series database (TSDB)?
item.guid: What is time-series data, and why are we building a time-series database (TSDB)?
item.description: A primer on time-series data and time-series databases (TSDB), and why we decided to build QuestDB

item.title: Community contribution from Alex Pelagenko improving our HTTP server
item.guid: Community contribution from Alex Pelagenko improving our HTTP server
item.description: One of QuestDB’s major contributors, Alex Pelagenko, shares his experience on improving QuestDB’s HTTP server.

item.title: Authentication for InfluxDB line protocol
item.guid: Authentication for InfluxDB line protocol
item.description: QuestDB has added authentication for InfluxDB line protocol over TCP

item.title: Build a monitoring dashboard with QuestDB and Grafana
item.guid: Build a monitoring dashboard with QuestDB and Grafana
item.description: Use Grafana with QuestDB to build a monitoring dashboard for visualization of time series data.

item.title: NYC taxi meter and options pricing
item.guid: NYC taxi meter and options pricing
item.description: An experiment analyzing the NYC taxi dataset through the eyes of an options trader.

item.title: Why performance matters in time-series data
item.guid: Why performance matters in time-series data
item.description: Thoughts on why speed and performance are crucial to time series database ingestion and analytics.

item.title: A Lightweight, blazing fast stack for your IoT application
item.guid: A Lightweight, blazing fast stack for your IoT application
item.description: How to create a simple IoT stack that uses a Mosquitto MQTT Broker, Telegraf and QuestDB.

item.title: Re-examining our approach to memory mapping
item.guid: Re-examining our approach to memory mapping
item.description: What we learned by re-examining our approach to memory mapping. A low level implementation, as close as posibble to the kernel, enabled even greater performance.

item.title: My journey making QuestDB
item.guid: My journey making QuestDB
item.description: The detailed story of how the open source time series database QuestDB came to life.

item.title: QuestDB swag for our community members!
item.guid: QuestDB swag for our community members!
item.description: Participate to the QuestDB community and get rewarded with swag for your contributions.

item.title: InfluxDB line protocol on QuestDB
item.guid: InfluxDB line protocol on QuestDB
item.description: This tutorial shows an example IoT application using InfluxDB line protocol with QuestDB.

item.title: Demo launch on HackerNews retrospective
item.guid: Demo launch on HackerNews retrospective
item.description: What happens when you put a SQL database on the internet? Demo launch on HackerNews retrospective.

item.title: Querying data in a Jupyter Notebook
item.guid: Querying data in a Jupyter Notebook
item.description: Use a Jupyter notebook to create a database, insert and query data and graph the results using Python.

item.title: Sending IoT sensor data from Arduino to QuestDB
item.guid: Sending IoT sensor data from Arduino to QuestDB
item.description: See how to build an IoT application using Arduino, which sends temperature and humidity sensor data to QuestDB.

item.title: Things we learned about sums
item.guid: Things we learned about sums
item.description: What we learned implementing Kahan and Neumaier compensated sum algorithms, benchmark and comparison with Clickhouse.

item.title: Aggregating billions of rows per second with SIMD
item.guid: Aggregating billions of rows per second with SIMD
item.description: How SIMD instructions make aggregations faster in QuestDB, including benchmark results and a comparison with Postgres.

item.title: Speeding up InfluxDB line protocol
item.guid: Speeding up InfluxDB line protocol
item.description: Comparison between InfluxDB and QuestDB regarding the performance of the line protocol when ingesting data.
